intro: Myrsine leuconeura, commonly known as the New Zealand myrsine, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a distinctive white midrib. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Myrsine leuconeura is often found in forest understories and is adapted to the humid, temperate climate of its native habitat.
